channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Is Illiquidity a Blessing in Disguise for Some Investors?
item.description: Rather than running away from illiquidity, investment professionals, investors, and regulators alike should recognize its potential benefits and consider a more balanced approach.

item.title: Coca-Cola is going reverse Yankee by selling â‚¬1 billion of Euro debt to cover a potential tax charge
item.description: The beverage company has been in a long-drawn dispute with tax authorities in the U.S. over a $16 billion charge that it could possibly owe.

item.title: Scenario Planning, Foresight, and the Power of Imagination: Navigating an Uncertain Future
item.description: By fostering resilience through the consideration of various outcomes, investment practitioners can better anticipate and manage the complexities and disruptions that characterize today's dynamic environment.

item.title: Fed president throws doubt onto September rate cut Wall Street is desperate for
item.description: "We should be looking for the worst in the data rather than the best."

item.title: Private Equity: In Essence, Plunder?
item.description: To understand what private equity is at its worst is a call to action, personally and professionally.

item.title: Apple changes up App Store rules in Europe once again as EU threat of non-compliance grows
item.description: The commission said it "will assess Apple's eventual changes to the compliance measures, also taking into account any feedback from the market, notably developers".

item.title: Small Caps, Large Caps, and Interest Rates
item.description: The relationship between stocks and interest rates is not reliably stable. There are periods when equities are highly rate sensitive, and periods when they aren't.

item.title: Delta expects $380 million in lost sales from the CrowdStrike outage that forced it to cancel thousands of flights
item.description: The airline on Thursday confirmed that it was pursuing legal claims against CrowdStrike and Microsoft Corp. to recover damages.

item.title: How Well Does the Market Predict Volatility?
item.description: How accurate is VIX on a realized basis and when does it diverge with the market?

item.title: German giant Siemens beat profit estimates on the back of AI boom and demand for electrification
item.description: Siemens had long been a producer of heavy industrial equipment but has in recent years sought to shift its focus towards digital technology and factory automation.
